A technician should ignore personal information in and around a person’s computer. As mentioned back in Chapter 1, “Safety and Professionalism,” you should treat anything said to you and anything you see as a personal confidence, not to be repeated to customers, coworkers, or bosses. Salary by itself is not considered PII.
Personally identifiable information (PII) is a big umbrella for any data that can lead back to a specific individual.
HIPPA training normally suggests you deliver or dispose of confidential information found at a printer.

D should have been done before the work began.
If the tech somehow receives confidential documents or PII then it should be handed over to a manager (so the answer is correct imo) but the tech also needs to take reasonable steps so that it doesn't accidentally happen again.
